hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{10}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{5}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 5](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f75c498fb4e4414ffcf361cc00ddba703de5785d)

options.explanation:
We can reach the same total using $\blueD{5}$ equal jumps of $\maroonD{10}$ units.

![A number line labeled 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50. Arrows labeled, plus 10, point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8a8b1d5ca5420cea6ecdf92898e4d09bdb01d306)

$\blueD{5} \times \maroonD{10} = \underbrace{\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}}_{\blueD{5}\maroonD{\text{ tens}}}=\greenD{50}$

So $\maroonD{10}\times\blueD{5}=\greenD{50}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.*
